title: Erdős #871: Partitioning Additive Bases of Order 2

problemStatement.formal: A \text{ order-2 basis}, r_A(n) \to \infty \implies A = B \sqcup C \text{ both order-2 bases}?
problemStatement.plain: If A is an additive basis of order 2 with r_A(n) → ∞, can A be partitioned into two disjoint order-2 bases?

proven: Erdős-Nathanson (1989): FALSE for fixed r_A(n) ≥ t
Erdős-Nathanson (1989): TRUE when r_A(n) > c log n
